newsitem.title: USA: Mitchell to sell Woodlands for $543 mln.
newsitem.headline: Mitchell to sell Woodlands for $543 mln.

text.p: Mitchell Energy & Development Corp on Thursday said it reached a definitive agreement to sell Woodlands Corp to a partnership of Crescent Real Estate Equities Co and Morgan Stanley Real Estate Fund II LP for about $543 million in cash.

Mitchell, one of the largest independent producers of natural gas and natural gas liquids, said it expected an after-tax loss from the transaction of $55 million to $60 million, to be reflected in its second-quarter results.

The Woodlands is a 27,000 acre master-planned development 27 miles north of downtown Houston. It is home to 740 companies and institutions with a total employment of more than 17,000 and a residential population of about 50,000. It is 50 percent developed.
The deal is expected to close in 30 to 45 days, until after completion of due diligence and federal antitrust clearance.

"Having a free-standing energy company with significant cash availability gives us considerable flexibility to undertake subsequent steps to increase shareholder value," Mitchell said in a statement Thursday evening.
In a separate statement, Crescent said it would have 35 percent to 50 percent participation in the venture, with the precise level to be finalized before the deal closes.
Crescent now owns interests in 1.2 million square feet of office and retail properties at the Woodlands in joint venture with the Woodlands Corp, it said.
